titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1270) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the amendments made by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act which disqualify expenses for over-the-counter drugs under health savings accounts and health flexible spending arrangements.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1270) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the amendments made by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act which disqualify expenses for over-the-counter drugs under health savings accounts and health flexible spending arrangements.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-638, by Mr. Burgess.
The resolution provides that an amendment in the nature of a substitute consisting of the text of Rules Committee Print 114-60 shall be considered as adopted.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 127.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 793.

POSTPONED PROCEEDINGS - At the conclusion of debate on H.Res. 793, the Chair put the question on ordering the previous question and by voice vote, announced that the ayes had prevailed. Mr. McGovern demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of ordering the previous question until a time to be announced.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 231 - 168 (Roll no. 345).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 226 - 168 (Roll no. 346).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 1270) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the amendments made by the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act which disqualify expenses for over-the-counter drugs under health savings accounts and health flexible spending arrangements.
